Description: Upper body sherd of South Ionian pottery little master cup with handle root; interior glazed; exterior glazed save reserved handle zone, in which are a row of dots and an added plastic astragal with added red.
Type series: Schlotzhauer little master Ionian Cup type
Schlotzhauer Ionian Cup Type with application
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The fragment belongs to Schlotzhauer's South Ionian little master cups / South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9B. Several examples of Ionian cups with added plastic decoration are known, including knucklebones and heads of rams, bulls, panthers and lions (see Schlotzhauer 2012, 113). For a complete example, see Berlin 3678 from Rhodes (Walter-Karydi, Samos 6.1, pl. 42 no. 346).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 51, no. 176 pl. 41)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 258)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.756) (Phase 3)
